This Pokémon will always land a super-effective hit against the opponent.
This Pokémon will copy the opponent\'s stats (before any modifiers are applied).
The opponent will gain priority, regardless of who wins the point. (If both players play a Pokémon with truant, priority is decided as normal.)

When charged, raises the Pokémon\'s speed and grants you a cell battery.

Paralyzes, burns, or gives the opponent frostbite.

Poisons the opponent and gives the opponent a point of poison.

Boosts the Pokémon\'s attack when you\'re poisoned.

Prevents you from suffering from BREAK.

During harsh sunlight, inflicts a large amount of BREAK against the opponent.
During harsh sunlight, prevents you from having stats lowered or being inflicted with BREAK.

During strong winds, sharply raises your critical hit ratio.

Welcome to Pokémon Top Trumps! Click the button below to learn how to play!

Each round, the player whose turn it is chooses one of six attributes to compare by tapping the attribute, then both players submit their card, and whoever has the higher stat wind the hand. The losing player\'s Pokémon is knocked out and that player loses a point. A player is defeated when they hit 0 points.

At the beginning of the game, you have six lives. Each time you lose a hand, you lose one of these lives. In the event of a tie, the number of lives the next round is worth is increased by one. A player who loses all their lives is defeated.

Whenever you lose a hand, or if you\'re not the starting player, you will be given an item, which can be accessed from the items tab. During each hand, you can select an item to play to affect the round. To look at an item in greater detail, hold down on the item to enlarge it.
Some Pokémon have abilities that affect how they play. You can see what an ability does by tapping the ability on the card before you submit.

Certain Pokémon can mega evolve. When the mega evolution button turns black, you can press this to mega evolve your Pokémon. If you change your mind, you can toggle it again before you hit submit. Be aware, you can only mega evolve once per game, however.
Boosts the special attack of water types, and reduces the attack of fire types.
Boosts the attack of fire types, and reduces the special attack of water types.
Boosts the special defense of ice types.
Boosts the defense of ground and steel types.
Boosts the HP of grass types.
Boosts the speed of electric types.
Boosts the special defense of fairy types, and reduces the attack of dragon types.
Boosts the special attack of psychic types, and prevents effects that would change priority.
Boosts the speed of normal types, and prevents them from receiving extra damage from supereffective hits.
The winner of a trick is decided by the lowest number, instead of the highest.
Covers the field in darkness, reducing visibility and boosting the critical hit rate of dark types.
Lowers Pokémon\'s attack as long as the player has priority.
Lowers Pokémon\'s speed as long as the player has priority.
Pokémon the player controls can\'t transform or mega evolve.
Lowers Pokémon\'s special attack as long as the player has priority.
Causes the player to lose priority regardless of who wins the trick.
If the player has priority, randomizes the chosen attribute.
The player gains a point of poison each turn. Ten poison loses the game.
